description.p: You emanate an intense heat in a 10-foot radius centered on you, superheating the blood of any living creature that enters the zone. Creatures that start their turn in the radius or move into it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 5d8 fire damage, or half as much on a successful one.

At the end of each of its turns, creatures in the radius can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the creature and it is immune to this spell for 24 hours. This spell has no effect on the nonliving or creatures without blood such as constructs, oozes, plants, and undead.

Blood Magic. When you cast this spell , you can choose to deal an amount of force damage to yourself equal to half your level (minimum 1), this damage ignores resistances and immunities. When you do this, creatures that fail their Constitution saving throws have their movement reduced to zero until the end of their next turn.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

setters.set: a vial of blood and sulfur mixed together

description.p: You hurl a shard of crystallized blood from your body at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 piercing damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it can’t take reactions until the start of its next turn.

Blood Magic. When you cast this spell , you can choose to deal 1 damage to yourself, this damage ignores resistances and immunities. When you do this, add your Constitution modifier to the damage dealt.
At Higher Levels. This spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

You create a blood bond between you and a target within range through mutual open wounds. If the target is not willing, it makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the connection is made, if the target succeeds the spell ends. Whenever you or the target take non-psychic damage, both you and the bonded target each take half of the damage dealt. Additionally, both you and the target have disadvantage on attacks and saving throws made against each other.

Blood Magic. When you cast this spell , you can choose to deal an amount of force damage to yourself equal to half your level (minimum 1), this damage ignores resistances and immunities. When you do this, you can bond with a second target, splitting all damage into thirds across you and both targets.

You infuse the plasma in your blood with caustic acid in response to a wound being opened on your body, spraying acidic blood from the wound at your assailant. The creature that damaged you must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes 2d10 acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Blood Magic. When you cast this spell , you can choose to deal an amount of force damage to yourself equal to half your level (minimum 1), this damage ignores resistances and immunities. When you do this, the range becomes a 15 foot cone, affecting all creatures within it.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

setters.set: 1 reaction, which you take in response to being damaged by a creature with either piercing or slashing damage
A vial of blood and acid mixed together

description.p: You attempt to turn the blood of one creature in range against itself, causing its immune system to turn and attack the target’s body. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes 3d6 poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature affected by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends. This spell has no effect on the nonliving or creatures without blood such as constructs, oozes, plants, and undead.

Blood Magic. When you cast this spell , you can choose to deal an amount of force damage to yourself equal to half your level (minimum 1), this damage ignores resistances and immunities. When you do this, you can target an additional creature within range.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3rd.

When a creature walks within 5 feet of of a recently slain foe, you can force the blood in its body to expand rapidly, causing the body to explode. Any creature within a 5 foot radius of the body must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save the creature takes 3d8 necrotic damage, or half as much on a successful one.

Blood Magic. When you cast this spell , you can choose to deal an amount of force damage to yourself equal to half your level (minimum 1), this damage ignores resistances and immunities. When you do this, creatures affected by the explosion are knocked prone regardless of whether they passed or failed.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

setters.set: 1 reaction, which you take in response to a creature coming within 5 feet of a corpse
a piece of bone or flesh from a corpse

description.p: You cut a gash into your hand and form the blood into a blade in your free hand. The blade is similar in size and shape to a scimitar, and lasts for the duration. If you let go of the blade, it splatters blood in a 5-foot radius and the spell ends. You can use you action to make a melee spell attack with the crimson blade. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 necrotic damage.

Blood Magic. When you cast this spell , you can choose to deal an amount of force damage to yourself equal to half your level (minimum 1), this damage ignores resistances and immunities. When you do this, releasing the blade causes the blood splatter it makes to explode. Each creature within the 5 foot radius must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 1d6 necrotic damage, or half as much on a successful save.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for every two slot levels above 2nd.

setters.set: a full flask of the caster’s blood

description.p: You lash out with a bolt of necrotic energy. Make a ranged spell attack against a medium or smaller creature. On a hit, the target takes 4d10 necrotic damage. If the target is cursed and this spell drops it to 0 hit points, it dies, and the energy of your curse fills it with new life. The creature is raised as a zombie under your control.

After 1 minute the curse's energy runs out and your undead servant dies, crumbling to dust. The statistics for a zombie can be found on page 316 of the Monster Manual. This spell has no effect against constructs or undead.
The next time you hit a cursed creature with a melee weapon attack during this spell’s duration, your weapon radiates dark energy, and the attack deals an extra 3d8 necrotic damage to the target.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

You fill an area with magical energy that slows and weakens your enemies. Medium and smaller creatures other than you can't take reactions and have disadvantage on saving throws as long as they remain in the field.

You touch a target that contains blood and attempt to drain it for your own vitality. Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes 2d10 necrotic damage and you gain temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

Blood Magic. When you cast this spell , you can choose to deal an amount of force damage to yourself equal to half your level (minimum 1), this damage ignores resistances and immunities. When you do this, you gain the full damage dealt in temporary hit points instead of half.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

You and one willing creature enter a blood pact that invigorates you at the expense of their own well being. When you cast this spell, the target expends one unspent hit dice and you gain temporary hit points equal to the maximum roll of the expended hit dice + your spellcasting modifier.

Blood Magic. When you cast this spell , you can choose to deal an amount of force damage to yourself equal to half your level (minimum 1), this damage ignores resistances and immunities. When you do this, the target that expends the hit die gains the same amount of temporary hit points.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you gain an additional 5 temporary hit points for every slot level above 4th.

setters.set: a vial of the caster’s blood mixed with the blood of a willing participant

description.p: You wreath yourself in ethereal energy, only partially existing on the material plane. For the duration of the spell, you can move through the spaces of hostile creatures, and opportunity attacks made against you have disadvantage. If you end your turn in the space of a hostile creature, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space within 5 feet of the creature.

You touch an enemy and attemtp to freeze the blood in their veins. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit the target takes 1d6 cold damage and you gain advantage on the next cantrip you cast against the same target before the start of your next turn.
This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6)

You manipulate the blood of another living creature and attempt to force it from its containment, drawing it from the body all at once. The pressure damages organs and ruptures tissue causing excruciating pain.

The target makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 10d8 bludgeoning damage. On a successful save the target only takes half damage. If the target is a medium or smaller creature and the damage reduces it below 50 hit points, it immediately dies.

Blood Magic. When you cast this spell , you can choose to deal an amount of force damage to yourself equal to half your level (minimum 1), this damage ignores resistances and immunities. When you do this, the size of the creature to qualify for instant death increases to large.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 6th.

You touch a container of nonmagical ammunition, such a pouch of sling bullets, or a quiver of arrows. When a target is hit by a ranged weapon attack using a piece of ammunition from the enchanted container, the target takes an extra 1d6 fire damage.
The spell’s magic destroys the piece of ammunition when it hits or misses, and the spell ends early if all ammunition from the enchanted container are expended.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 1 hour. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 8 hours.
For the duration of the spell, spells you cast that push the creatures cause those creatures to be pushes an additional 15 feet.

You cause the air around several creatures to explode with kinetic energy. Choose up to 3 creatures within range. Each of those creatures must make a Dexterity saving throw or take 3d6 force damage and pushed 10 feet. On a successful save, the creatures take no damage, but are still pushed the 10 feet.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can choose an additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.
You blast a creature within range with pure kinetic force. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take 1d6 force damage and be pushed 10 feet.
This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

You cover the ground in enchanted liquid, causing kinetic backlash when a creature steps on it. You cover a 5 foot square within range with the mercury used in the casting of this spell. When a creature steps into the space occupied by the mercury it makes a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 3d10 force damage and is pushed back 15 feet. If the movement forced by this spell ends due to the creature colliding with an object such as a wall, it takes 1d6 damage for every 5 feet of movement caused by the spell. If the creature's movement ends due to collision with another creature, both creatures take the damage and are knocked prone. After 1 minute or once the mercury has been detonated, it loses it magic.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the initial damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 5th.

The energy of your curse reveals weaknesses in your opponents. You gain advantage on your next attack made against a cursed target. If you hit, the curse is consumed, removing it from the target. This ends your concentration on curse spells such as bestow curse or hex.

Your curse links you to those it afflicts, giving you supernatural insights into their next move. Cursed creatures have disadvantage on weapon attacks made against you and you have advantage on saving throws made against spells cast by cursed creatures until the beginning of your next turn.

setters.set: 1 reaction, which you take when you are the target of a weapon attack or forced to make a saving throw from a spell.

description.p: You hurl a mote of kinetic energy at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 2d8 force damage and must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it is also pushed 15 feet.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

You alter the kinetic energy within a creature, forcing it to give off waves of repelling energy. When the spell is first cast or it is the start of the target's turn, the target makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, each creature within 5 feet of the target take 4d4 force damage and is pushed 5 feet away from the target. On a successful save, the spell ends.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 3rd.

You unleash a wave of destructive force at a nearby foe. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit the target takes 1d6 thunder damage, if the target is Medium or smaller, it makes a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target is pushed 10 feet away.
This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

The sound of blood pumping within living creatures flows through your senses like a river's current. Until the end of your next turn, you know the location of any living beast or humanoid creature within 60 feet of you.

You know the type of any being whose presence you sense, but not the identity of the creature. This spell can penetrate most barriers, but is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

Blood Magic. When you cast this spell , you can choose to deal an amount of force damage to yourself equal to half your level (minimum 1), this damage ignores resistances and immunities. When you do this, the spell can peer through barriers with greater ease, only being blocked by 2 feet of stone, 6 inches of common metal, 1 inch of lead, or 10 feet of wood or dirt.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, your senses expand, allowing you to also locate monstrosities, giants, and dragons.

You summon a spectral sword in your open hand and swing it at a creature within 5 feet of you. Make a melee spell attack at a creature in range, on a hit the target takes 1d6 slashing damage. If you have the Extra Attack feature and you cast this spell as an action, you can use your bonus action to cast this spell a second time on the same turn.
This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

Tentacles of blood erupt from your body and stave off attackers around you. Any creature that starts its turn or enters the area for the first time must make a dexterity saving throw. On a failed save the target takes 2d6 bludgeoning damage and is pushed back 5 feet. On a successful save, the target takes half damage and is not pushed back.

Blood Magic. When you cast this spell , you can choose to deal an amount of force damage to yourself equal to half your level (minimum 1), this damage ignores resistances and immunities. When you do this, the range of the push on a failed save is increased to 10 feet and creatures that succeed on the save are pushed 5 feet.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for every slot levels above 2nd.

Your curse reaches into the mind of its victim and alters its thoughts to become a protective thrall. A cursed creature within range of your choice makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is charmed by you for the duration.

While it is charmed in this manner, it acts with violence towards any creature that is hostile to you, using its action to move and make weapon attacks against any creature that has attacked you since you cast this spell.
When the thrall takes damage, or at the end of each of its turns, it can make a Wisdom saving throw, ending the spell on a success.

You lash out at a creature that damage you, momentarily summoning a spectral blade to deliver the blow. Make a melee spell attack against the creature that damaged you. On a hit, the target takes 2d10 slashing damage.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

setters.set: 1 reaction, which you take in response to being damaged by a creature within 5 feet of you that you can see.
